fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight Automation to send POST payload to Azure webhook doesn't work

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*+On Azure Side:+*
* Create account - Getting Started with Azure Automation: Introduction [ipswitch.com|https://blog.ipswitch.com/getting-started-with-azure-automation-introduction] (section "Create an Automation Account using the Portal")
* Create runbook - just press + to create runbook inside Automation account and choose powershell type of runbook
* Create webhook - [Start an Azure Automation runbook from a webhook - Microsoft Docs|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/automation/automation-webhooks#from-the-portal]

*+On Insight side:+*
* Create a sample Automation rule like this:
!2021-10-08_18-02-09.png|width=100%!
* Trigger the automation by updating the selected object type





h3. Expected Results
* the triggered automation does send the payload to the Azure webhook endpoint 

h3. Actual Results

* We see the {{insight_automation.log}} does show a successful HTTP request sent:
{noformat}
2021-10-08 12:25:17,445 [insight-event-0] | Got rule and event for insightObjectAsyncEvent: null, id: 1 - InsightObjectEvent eventType: OBJECT_UPDATED, rule id: 1, name: Testing Azure Webhook, isActive true, objectRuleEvent id: 1 and object: Dell PowerEdge VRTX (MOS-17)
2021-10-08 12:25:17,448 [insight-event-0] | doAction(), called for event class: InsightObjectUpdatedEvent
2021-10-08 12:25:17,448 [insight-event-0] | Object name: Dell PowerEdge VRTX, id: 17
2021-10-08 12:25:17,448 [insight-event-0] | Execute Rule action (AutomationRuleHttpRequestAction): Start, id: 1, event [id: 1, iql: No iql], condition: objectType = Server
2021-10-08 12:25:17,924 [insight-event-0] | Execute Rule action (AutomationRuleHttpRequestAction), Result: POST executed. Url: https://dc14d534-86de-4a0b-852a-471ff06c9ed2.webhook.dewc.azure-automation.net/webhooks?token=vjzcXzm2d5hXCJn2cUlmbRv7t8A81eiQRDxEn3Iv7gg%3d data: {
    "Key": MOS-17
}
2021-10-08 12:25:17,924 [insight-event-0] | Execute Rule action (AutomationRuleHttpRequestAction): Done, id:1, event [id: 1, iql: No iql, condition: objectType = Server
{noformat}
* However, Azure doesn't receive this payload and in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} the below {{FileNotFoundException}} exception is thrown:
{noformat}
2021-10-08 12:25:17,921+0000 insight-event-0 ERROR admin     [c.r.j.p.i.services.util.InsightHttpRequester] InsightHttpRequester.doRequest() Failed to send Http request for data: {"url":"https://dc14d534-86de-4a0b-852a-471ff06c9ed2.webhook.dewc.azure-automation.net/webhooks?token=vjzcXzm2d5hXCJn2cUlmbRv7t8A81eiQRDxEn3Iv7gg%3d","method":"POST","postData":"{\n    \"Key\": MOS-17\n}","username":null,"password":"********"}
java.io.FileNotFoundException: https://dc14d534-86de-4a0b-852a-471ff06c9ed2.webhook.dewc.azure-automation.net/webhooks?token=vjzcXzm2d5hXCJn2cUlmbRv7t8A81eiQRDxEn3Iv7gg%253d
	at java.base/sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream0(HttpURLConnection.java:1920)
	at java.base/sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(HttpURLConnection.java:1520)
	at java.base/sun.net.www.protocol.https.HttpsURLConnectionImpl.getInputStream(HttpsURLConnectionImpl.java:250)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.util.InsightHttpRequester.doRequest(InsightHttpRequester.java:82)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.automation.action.AutomationRuleHttpRequestAction.doActionSafe(AutomationRuleHttpRequestAction.java:56)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.automation.action.AbstractInsightAutomationAction.doAction(AbstractInsightAutomationAction.java:107)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.automation.rule.impl.AutomationRuleEngineImpl.executeAction(AutomationRuleEngineImpl.java:675)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.automation.rule.impl.AutomationRuleEngineImpl.executeActions(AutomationRuleEngineImpl.java:660)

	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.automation.rule.impl.AutomationRuleEngineImpl.handleAsyncEvent(AutomationRuleEngineImpl.java:214)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.automation.event.AutomationRuleEventListener.onAsyncEvent(AutomationRuleEventListener.java:94)
	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:566)
	at com.google.common.eventbus.Subscriber.invokeSubscriberMethod(Subscriber.java:87)
	at com.google.common.eventbus.Subscriber$SynchronizedSubscriber.invokeSubscriberMethod(Subscriber.java:144)
	at com.google.common.eventbus.Subscriber$1.run(Subscriber.java:72)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.executor.ThreadLocalDelegateRunnable.run(ThreadLocalDelegateRunnable.java:34)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1128)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:829)
{noformat}
* Notice how the URL gets further *encoded* by Jira:

||Actual URL||Jira Encoded URL||
|{noformat}https://dc14d534-86de-4a0b-852a-471ff06c9ed2.webhook.dewc.azure-automation.net/webhooks?token=vjzcXzm2d5hXCJn2cUlmbRv7t8A81eiQRDxEn3Iv7gg%3d{noformat}|{noformat}https://dc14d534-86de-4a0b-852a-471ff06c9ed2.webhook.dewc.azure-automation.net/webhooks?token=vjzcXzm2d5hXCJn2cUlmbRv7t8A81eiQRDxEn3Iv7gg%253d{noformat}|
|Azure Token '{{%3d}}'|Gets encoded as '{{%253d}}'|

h3. Workaround
* Replace the *{{%3d}}* at the end of the token with *{{=}}* in the URL so that when it tries to encode again it coverts it to %3d in the token(*)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary



When using the global object search and exporting the results, it is not possible to export it in user friendly format. It is set to data consistent format by default. The problem with this, is when you want to have usernames in Jira user attributes instead of user keys. The client wants to have the option to be able to see the user names instead.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to "Search for objects" 
!Screenshot 2021-10-07 at 12.43.46.png|width=464,height=171!
 # Enter the IQL Queiary for the objectType with a user attribute you want to export
 # Export the the results and see that the user name does not show

h3. Expected Results



The client wants the name of the user to be shown e.g "Thomas Grahn" instead of JIRAUSERXXXXX

!Screenshot 2021-10-07 at 12.43.08.png|width=585,height=168!
h3. Actual Results

Does not show the user name of the Jira user
h3. Workaround

You can still achieve this result from exporting from the objectType Insight UI menu by choosing user friendly format
!Screenshot 2021-10-07 at 12.34.34.png|width=307,height=257!
fields.summary: Insight export user friendly format global search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Importing using the Schema Import Type - the datalocator for an "Object" Attribute will be represented by the Target Object Type Name. If I have several Attributes on the Object Type I am importing, all pointing to the same Object Type - once imported, all will be populated by the SAME Object, because there is only one Datalocator available.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a Schema "Schema A" with two Object Types: OTA and OTB
 # Create a few objects in OTA, with Names like: O1, O2, O3
 # On OTB, navigate to the Attributes Tab and add 3 Object Attributes, all referencing OTA:
 Ref1
 Ref2
 Ref3
 # Create an Object in OTB with different references OTA objects:
 Ref1 : O1
 Ref2 : O2
 Ref3 : O3
 # In another Schema / instance, configure an Insight Object schema import Type to import from "Schema A". you may use a predefined structure / configuration or set the structure and mapping manually.
 # Note the OTB Object Type Mapping for the referenced Attributes - they are all using the exact same Datalocator: OTA ...
 # Synchronize the import 

h3. Expected Results

The Imported OTB object will have the correct referenced OTA Objects (imported):
 Ref1 : O1
 Ref2 : O2
 Ref3 : O3
h3. Actual Results

Ref1 : O1
 Ref2 : O1
 Ref3 : O1
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Use the Insight>Schema Export to export your Schema into a Zip file, then use Insight>Schema Import to import your schema in the target instance - this method will maintain the references as expected
fields.summary: Insight Object Schema Import Type cannot import Multiple Attributes if they are referencing the same Object Type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you create an attribute of type version, you will need to select the project to populate the options.
 This list of projects should be filtered on starting to type the project name. This does not happen.
 Even worse when you have a high number of projects ( > 2500 ) the list is no longer complete, and will not allow you to select a project, that is not on the list.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create environment with 2500+ projects
 # Have Object Schema with objectType Project
 # Add attribute of type *Version*
 # Type project name

h3. Expected Results

List gets filtered based on typing. Project gets selected
h3. Actual Results

List doesn't get filtered, even if it states so:
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-01 at 11.30.38.png|thumbnail!

If you type the full name of a project, that is not on the list, it will be listed as invalid:
 !image.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

The attribute can be set using the [Insight Rest API|https://confluence.atlassian.com/insightapps/insight-rest-api-1085180885.html] .

To add the attribute of type version you would need a RestAPI call with the following details
{code:java}
POST <BASE_URL>rest/insight/1.0/objecttypeattribute/<objecttypeID>' 
{code}
<objecttypeID> is the id of the objectType, you want to add this attribute.
 You will need to specify "Content-Type: application/json" and the body should then be something like
{code:java}
{"name":"Version","type":5,"typeValue":"10001"}
{code}
The typeValue corresponds to the projectID , not the projectkey or projectname. To get the projectID, please see [How to get project id from the Jira User Interface|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-get-project-id-from-the-jira-user-interface-827341414.html]
fields.summary: Creating an attribute of type version the list of projects doesn't allow for selection of all projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Old object schema Edit object page doesn't handle DST (Daylight Saving Time) changes and continues to show Non-DST date and time. This creates confusion in users as the date/time value in the edit pop up is inconsistent with the object schema view page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an attribute of DateTime type
 # Change your jira user profile to a timezone which has DST changes (ex. GMT+01:00) if you're not in one already
 # Create an object with the datetime attribute for example {{1/Nov/21 11:00 PM}} value
 

h3. Expected Results
The DST adjustments are consistent across the board

h3. Actual Results
* Check the attribute value in the *object schema view* to {{1/Nov/21 10:00 PM}} (adjusted -1H for DST)
* Click on the edit button and see it go back to {{1/Nov/21 11:00 PM}}
 !image-2021-09-30-20-29-38-576.png|width=100%! 


h3. Workaround

The new object view page doesn't seem to be affected by this bug.
 !image-2021-09-30-20-30-52-079.png|width=100%!
fields.summary: Object Schema Edit page doesn't handle DST changes - inconsistent with the Object Schema view page

h3. Issue Summary

Can't preview MP4 video in customer portal with Google Chrome, MS Edge, Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Jira Service Management:
-- v4.17.0, v4.17.1
- Browser:
-- Google Chrome(Mac): Version 93.0.4577.82 (Official Build) (x86_64), Version 94.0.4606.61 (Official Build) (x86_64)
-- MS Edge(Mac): Version 94.0.992.31 (Official build) (x86_64)
-- Safari(Mac): Version 15.0 (16612.1.29.41.4, 16612)

Step 1. Attach/Upload MP4 video file in JSM customer portal
Step 2. When you click attachment file link in customer portal, you can't preview the MP4 video.

 !jsm-4171-mp4_in_portal-edge.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Note

Jira Service Management v4.13.7, v4.14.0 are not affected to this issue.

h3. Actual Results

Use Firefox instead of Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge(Chromium), Safari.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A cache error is causing failures to create Insight objects from the create issue screen. This problem happens only in very specific conditions:
 * Object types with user or select list attributes
 * Objects have an inheritance 
 * Permissions are given to the child and removed from the parent

During the investigation, we found that the error happens when the API request sends the objectSchemaId parameter as "false" instead of the correct number.

 !image-2021-09-27-18-55-28-602.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-09-27-18-55-38-400.png|thumbnail! 

This seems to be caused by a missing cache that is just created when we attempt to create the object from Insight UI. After accessing the UI, Jira starts to send the correct number to the API, stopping the error.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open issue creation screen
 # Click to create a new Insight object from a custom field
 # Attempt to get the values from a user or select list attribute.

h3. Expected Results

Jira show the values from the attributes
h3. Actual Results

The UI shows the following

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2021-09-20 17:37:57,555+0000 http-nio-127.0.0.102-8080-exec-19 DEBUG tuser 1057x113170x1 mpexbp 13.82.51.28,127.0.0.1 /secure/QuickCreateIssue!default.jspa [c.r.j.p.i.s.j.customfield.util.CustomFieldUpdateErrorsCache] get - key: IE_U_ERR__customfield_10444_null_10964
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Access the Insight Object Schema, attempt to create the object from there. This will show the field values and also allow Jira to get the field values from the issue creations screen.
fields.summary: Create Insight objects from Jira create issue screen causes error

fields.description:
h3. Issue

Due to security concern, from JSM 4.6.0, the automation module was updated in a way that it will only send a webhook to an URL if this URL has been whitelisted, as per [this developer community discussion|https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/automation-webhooks-must-be-on-the-jira-system-whitelist/32999]. For this reason, whenever a new automation rule is configured to sent a webhook, it is necessary to whitelist the webhook URL in the page *⚙ > System > Whitelist* for the automation to send the webhook. Otherwise, the automation will not be executed.

Another issue is that the JSM automation rule always shows a SUCCESS in the logs regardless if the webhook was sent or not (due to the whitelisting). This is a bug tracked in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-6955.

The problem is that our official [documentation about JSM automation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/automating-your-service-project-939926334.html] does not say anything about whitelisting the webhook URLs for JSM automation rules to work.

On top of it, there is nothing in the JSM automation UI that tells users that they have to whitelist the webhook URL at the time they are creating the automation rule.

Ideally, we should update both the UI (by adding a warning to the user configuring the automation rule), and we should update the documentation, so that users can refer to it.

Related KB article: [Webhooks are not sent from Jira Service Management Automation rules|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/webhooks-are-not-sent-from-jira-service-management-automation-rules-1087512315.html]

h3. Suggestion

Update the section *Customize automation webhooks* of the documentation [https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/automating-your-service-project-939926334.html] by mentioning that from JSM 4.6.0, any webhook URL needs to be whitelisted in *⚙ > System > Whitelist* for the webhook to be sent.
fields.summary: Improve the Service Management automation documentation to mention the whitelisting of webhook

fields.description:
*Description* 

Insight - Asset Management has a feature to import data from several databases (DBs). One of these DBs, the H2 DB, has a native function in its library which an attacker can use to run code on the server (remote code execution a.k.a. RCE). The H2 DB is bundled with Jira to help speed up the setup of Jira test environments.

The combination of the DB import feature introduced by Insight - Asset Management with the existing Jira H2 DB library exposed this vulnerability. The vulnerability exists whether or not the import configuration was saved and even if H2 was never used as a targeted DB. Accessing this vulnerability requires the following:
 * The user must be an authenticated Jira user *AND*

Either of the following privileges within Insight - Asset Management:
 * user or group permission to “Insight administrator”

 * user or group permission to “Object Schema Manager”

 
h4. Acknowledgments

The issue was discovered by l0gg via the Atlassian public bug bounty program.

 

*Affected versions:*
|Insight - Asset Management version:
 * All 5.x versions
 * All 6.x versions
 * All 7.x versions
 * All 8.0.x, 8.1.x, 8.2.x, 8.3.x, 8.4.x, 8.5.x, 8.6.x, 8.7.x, 8.8.x versions
 * All 8.9.x versions before 8.9.3|

Jira Service Management Data Center and Server version:
 * All 4.15.x versions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Dates lagging one day are saved in the Database when using Type Value *Date* attribute in Insight and Server timezone is GMT-XXX.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Set up a Jira instance with Insight 8.9.1 with America/Los_Angeles TimeZone (GMT-8)
 * Ensure Server - Jira Timezones are all set to:
 ** jira.default.timezone: America/Los_Angeles
 ** jvm.system.timezone : US/Pacific
 ** Mysql Database Timezone: PDT
 !image-2021-09-16-11-03-03-920.png|thumbnail!
 !image-2021-09-16-11-03-45-333.png|thumbnail!

 * Create an Object Type and add a *Date* Attribute
 !image-2021-09-16-10-44-26-487.png|thumbnail! 
  
 * Create an object and set a date, for instance, *12/Sep*
 !image-2021-09-16-10-55-40-203.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Date should be stored as 2021-09-12
h3. Actual Results

Date is stored as *2021-09-11* 17:00:00.
 Exactly -7 hours (Pacific Daylight Time) behind GTM

Query to get an attribute value:
{code:sql}
SELECT 
       OTA.NAME OTA_NAME,
      	OAV.DATE_VALUE 
FROM AO_8542F1_IFJ_OBJ O
         LEFT OUTER JOIN AO_8542F1_IFJ_OBJ_ATTR OA ON O.ID = OA.OBJECT_ID
         LEFT OUTER JOIN AO_8542F1_IFJ_OBJ_TYPE_ATTR OTA ON OTA.ID = OA.OBJECT_TYPE_ATTRIBUTE_ID
         LEFT OUTER JOIN AO_8542F1_IFJ_OBJ_ATTR_VAL OAV ON OA.ID = OAV.OBJECT_ATTRIBUTE_ID
WHERE OA.OBJECT_ID = 4 and OTA.NAME = 'Date'
{code}
!image-2021-09-16-11-06-51-724.png|thumbnail!

The below call is made in the atlassian-jira.log.log file. We observed date is already incorrect.
{noformat}
2021-09-13 07:00:59,301-0700 http-nio-8080-exec-2 admin 420x1374x1 14mz3i7 /rest/insight/1.0/object/create 3 ms "INSERT INTO AO_8542F1_IFJ_OBJ_ATTR_VAL (OBJECT_ATTRIBUTE_ID,ADDITIONAL_VALUE,INTEGER_VALUE,DOUBLE_VALUE,TEXT_VALUE,DATE_VALUE,REFERENCED_OBJECT_ID,BOOLEAN_VALUE) VALUES (?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?)" {1=23, 2=null, 3=null, 4=null, 5=null, 6=2021-09-11 17:00:00.0, 7=null, 8=null}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Date values inconsistency for timezone GMT-XXX

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There is an option in Insight to define roles on Object Type level. However, only Insight/Jira admins are able to perform this option, users with lower permission roles such as Object Schema Managers receive a {{403 - Forbidden}} error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a user to the Object Schema Manager's role. Login to the user granted the Object Schema Manager role.
# Navigate to an Object type, select Object Type -> Configure.
# Try to add a user to any Object Type role.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
As you start typing, or selecting a user, a list of matches should pop up, and a user should be added.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
* (i) The above screenshot is taken as an Admin user.

h3. Actual Results
An error is thrown on the front end
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

The access log and HAR file will show a 403 error
{code}
10.0.2.2 870x864x1 test [15/Sep/2021:14:30:12 +0200] "GET /jira858/rest/insight/1.0/user/picker?showAvatar=true&objectSchemaId=&query=a&exclude=&_=1631709001293 HTTP/1.1" 403 183 65 "http://ub2:8080/jira858/secure/InsightConfigure.jspa?objecttypeid=1&tab=roles" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.14; rv:91.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/91.0" "17azp9"
{code}
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Reproduced using versions
* 8.7.10 (was impacted in JSDSERVER-7173)
* 8.7.12
* 9.1.0 (Bundled latest)



h3. Additional information
We experienced a similar behavior for the Object Schema roles, which was fixed in [JSDSERVER\-7173: Object Schema Managers are not able to add users in the roles (fixed in Jira Service Management Server and Data Center 4.18.1, Insight 8.7.11)|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-7173].

In this fix, we added {{ObjectSchemaId}} to the request URL
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 


As we can see in the screenshot of the HAR file, the {{ObjectSchemaId}} variable is added to the request URL correct, however it's set as null and thus throwing a {{403 - Forbidden}} error since we're trying to update Object Roles for a nonexistent Schema. {{ObjectSchemaId}} was already present in the requestURL in 8.7.10 during my test using this version.

If I manually edit the request and add the schema ID value, the request will go through.
 !screenshot-6.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-7.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Allocate the required roles using an Admin account.
fields.summary: Object Schema Managers receive a 403 - Forbidden response while trying to add a user to an Object Type role

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Insight currently keeps a history whenever there is an update to any of the objects' Attributes (with a NEW Value), a new row will be added to *AO_8542F1_IFJ_OBJ_HIST* table.

This table can increase dramatically in size.
h3. Suggested Solution

Possibles solutions:
 * May be a service retention period or cleanup mechanism in Insight to allow users to specify the criteria for deletion.
 * May be a feature to exclude an attribute or object type from recording history. This would be very useful on objects or attributes that are updated automatically by automated imports with very large data.
 * May be a feature to allow admins to limit the number of characters or size within a TextArea attribute in Insight, it might help to reduce Object's History table size

h3. Workaround

Currently, to remove/reduce Object's History table size, a Database query to delete rows from the AO_8542F1_IFJ_OBJ_HIST table needs to be run.

Detailed workaround is published in this KB: [Insight - How to delete Object History logs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/insight-how-to-delete-object-history-logs-1076827402.html]
fields.summary: Object's History table size cleanup mechanism

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight custom field value selection is not retained in Issue navigator when adding an issue type or project filter
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Insight object custom field and assign it to one project over several issue types
 # Create some test issue over different issue types in above project and make sure that at least 2 issues have different issue types but same object value selected in the custom field.
 # In Basic Search, first filter by the Insight custom field so that 2 issues are retrieved from 2 different issue types:
  !Screenshot 2021-09-13 at 11.39.01.png|thumbnail! 
 # Now select the Issue Type or the project to filter additionally and switch to Advanced search to validate the JQL. Observe that the Insight custom field value selection is cleared and all issue for that Issue type are so retrieved:
 !Screenshot 2021-09-13 at 11.39.29.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Insight custom field value selection should be retained in the JQL no matter how it's added to the basic search

h3. Actual Results
Insight custom field value selection is not retained in the JQL if the field and value are added before other search criteria. For example
{code}
"Insight field" = AD-7 AND project = ITSD
{code}
will become
{code}
project = ITSD
{code}
when switching to Advanced Search.

However, if the search for the Insight custom field is added last in the Basic search, this behavior is not reproducible.

(i) Here's a quick video to demonstrate the issue:  [^basicSearch.mov] 

h3. Workaround
Use Advanced search or select/filter the Insight custom field(s) last

h3. Notes
* Tested with more than 1 Insight custom field in the JQL, all search criteria related to Insight custom fields are removed if these were added before other search criteria for non-Insight custom fields
* Tested with other custom field types (like Team field from Advanced Roadmaps) and also from third-party plugins, issue is not reproducible and only Insight custom fields are removed
* Tested with a standard Jira custom field (e.g. Select list). The search criteria doesn't get removed regardless of the sequence of adding the search criteria in Basic search
fields.summary: Insight custom field value selection is not retained in Issue navigator when adding an issue type or project filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Importing from source (e.g. CSV or Jira Environment Integration), The IQL mapping of multiple values into an Object Type Attribute does not work as expected when using the LIKE function.
If all values are having same Case Letters combination - all will work well
If some values have only Lower Case letters - only these values will be found, while all values having at least upper case character will fail.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Object Type "AAA" with several objects in it - label them like: AAA, bbb, CCC, dDd
 # Configure Object Type "BBB" with an Attribute "RefObj" to reference Object Type "AAA" (cardinality max unlimited) - do not create any objects
Also add a Text Attribute called RefText
 # Create a CSV file, like:
Name,REF
B1,aaa||bbb||ccc||ddd
B2,AAA||BBB||CCC||DDD
B3,aaa||BBB||ccc||dDd
B4,aaa||bbb||CCC||dDd
 # Configure a CSV Import, using the file above into OT "BBB"
 # Map Name>>>Name
         REF   >>>RefObj with the IQL map: Name LIKE (${REF${0})
         REF   >>>RefText

h3. Expected Results

Object B1 will reference all 4 objects

Object B2 will reference all 4 objects

Object B3 will reference all 4 objects

Object B4 will reference all 4 objects
h3. Actual Results

Object B1 is referencing all 4 objects

Object B2 is referencing all 4 objects

*Object B3 is referencing only the AAA, CCC objects*

*Object B4 is referencing only the AAA,bbb objects*

In all cases - the RefText Attribute will show the concatenated 4 values as appearing in the CSV (same Case format)
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight - IQL function 'LIKE' does not work as expected in Attribute Mapping IQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attributes that has the type status with a current status I.e "active" gets removed when we import data from an external source like a CSV import for example.

This affect Insight Version 8.5.2 and forward
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Object Type with a Status Attribute (no need to select statuses)
 # Create a few Objects and make sure the Status Attribute is set to Active
 # You can also configure an Automation rule to set the Status to Active when an Object is created.
 # Create a CSV file to import - so that New Objects will be created, and existing Objects will be "Missing Objects"
 # Configure an Import (any, but easier with CSV) and map to your object type's Attributes, do not map the Status Attribute
 # Set the Missing Object to Update: Status Attribute to Inactive
 # Sync the import
 # Note that everything works as expected: the Missing Objects are showing Status:Inactive, New Objects are showing Active (if Automation Rule was configured, otherwise, bulk edit them and set Status to Active)
 # update some attributes in the CSV and import again, so that some Objects will be updated

h3. Expected Results

Missing Objects show Status Inactive, All other Objects showing Status Active
h3. Actual Results

Missing Objects show Status Inactive, All updated Objects showing "No Value" for Status

This does not happen when Missing Objects: Ignore 
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Add an automation rule:

WHEN: object Updated IF: Status IS EMPTY THEN: Attribute Value: Status to Active
fields.summary: Status value is removed when we import data with Insight

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the Create Transition:

When an Insight CF is configured with a Filter Issue Scope IQL including a Placeholder for a User Picker CF, the customer noticed that some Users allow the Insight CF to find their respective Objects, but some don't.

Older Users created in Jira 7.n have their userKey=username(lower) and these can be found, but for new users created in Jira 8.n the userKey is like "JIRAUSERnnnnn" and their objects cannot be found.

If an issue is already created, and a user is already set in the User Picker - the Insight IQL filter will work as expected for all users.

Seems like the User Picker CF may hold a Username, and will populate with an actual User only after the Create transition, hence the Insight placeholder, will look for the interim username in the Picker and try to match it against a userKey.

With the Reporter field - we know the nature of the field and run a User Lookup, or the filed is already populated accordingly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure you have some users with "older" userKeys as well as new users with userKeys in the new format "JIRAUSERnnnn"
 # Use the Insight Jira Users Import to import your users into Insight Objects
 # Configure a User Picker Custom Field - add it to the Create Screen
 # Configure an Insight Object CF; 
Filter Scope: objectType = User 
Filter Issue Scope: "Jira User" = ${customfield_nnnn} //the User Picker
//does not matter if you try customfield_nnnnn.key
 # Navigate to the Create screen and select an Old User - check the Insight CF options
 # Navigate to the Create screen and select an New User - check the Insight CF options

h3. Expected Results

In both cases - the respective Object/s are filtered in the Insight CF dropdown
h3. Actual Results

For an old User - the Insight CF will filter the respective objects

For a new User - the Insight CF will return 'No objects found'
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

add the Username as an attribute on the Object you wish to filter, and match the placeholder with this Attribute: "Username" = ${customfield_nnnnn}
fields.summary: Insight CF does not work in the Create Transition, If configured with placeholder for a Multi User Picker

fields.description:
h3. Issue Description

Some companies might have different working days depending on the week. For example:
- on week 1, the 7 days of the week are working days
- on week 2, only Monday-Friday are working days and Saturday/Sunday are non-working days

The problem with the way SLA calendars are currently designed, is that it is not possible to configure different working days depending on the week of the year. The working day configuration applies to all the weeks and cannot be adjusted for specific weeks.

h3. Suggestion

Add the possibility to configure different working days depending on the week.
fields.summary: Add the possibility to configure different working days depending on the week

fields.description:
ProForma Forms currently allows for limited conditional logic when displaying questions. A form can be configured to display a question (or info panel) if the answer to a previous question is (a) OR (b) OR ....

It would be great to have this functionality extended to allow for more advanced logic, such as:
 * 'AND' comparisons (display question if in previous question checkboxes (a) AND (b) have been selected)
 * 'NOT' comparisons (display question if in previous question the answer was NOT (a))
 * integrating multiple questions (e.g., display question if in previous question 1 the answer was (a) AND/OR in question 2 the answer was (b))

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the Insight Jira and Bitbucket integration, the Role objects get duplicated at every import with the Insight Jira import mapping configuration
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a schema configure the Jira Environment import by also creating the predefined structure and configuration
 # Observe that the *Role* object type mapping for the import has Role ID and Project ID as identifier which are referenced objects:
 !Screenshot 2021-09-08 at 13.13.34.png|thumbnail!
 # Sync the import 2 times and notice that while there should be only one Role for each project, those objects get instead duplicated at every subsequent sync. Furthermore the Deleted attribute is set to True for the ones previously created:
 !Screenshot 2021-09-08 at 12.47.41.png|thumbnail!

The root cause of this issue is unknown at the moment. Nothing really relevant into logs but it might be related to the References used as identifier and possible race condition.
h3. Expected Results

Only one role objects should be created and/or updated for each sync
h3. Actual Results

Role objects get duplicated
h3. Workaround

The workaround for now consists into creating a text attribute in the role object type, then inn the Role import mapping configuration, remove Role ID and Project ID as identifier and set the identifier to have:

Data Locator = Role ID +Project ID
 Insight Attribute = the text attribute created
 !image-2021-09-07-17-31-03-104.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: IJBI - Role objects get duplicated at every import with the Insight Jira import mapping configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When having multiple imports of the same time configured in the same schema, the only way to differentiate them in the Process Results Tab is by the import configuration ID. However, the Configuration ID can only be correlated to the Import Name in the DB or in the Insight Import Log, which is not always accessible.
It would be most beneficial to have the Import Configuration Name visible in its respective Process Results.
If I have 10 AWS Accounts, or 10 Azure Subscriptions configured in one Schema, I would like to see the results specifically for Account/Subscription nnn - indicated in the Import Configuration Name, but the Process result will only include an ID; 76, 78, 23 etc...
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two Insight Imports of the Same Type (e.g. JSON, CSV or other)
 # Run each Import configuration separately - each should create /update some objects
 # Navigate to the Process Results tab and try to identify each Import's Process Result

h3. Expected Results

I can see the Import Configuration Name, so I may expand details of one specific Import, e.g. "AWS Account aaaa" or "Azure Subscription nnnn"
h3. Actual Results

Multiple results each with the exact same Module Key, but different Configuration ID
{noformat}
Import module key: rlabs-import-type-csv version: 1 Import configuration id: 174 Time updating references: 845 ms
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Check the Insight-import.log to correlate the Configuration ID with the Import's Name.

There is no place in the UI to correlate an Import Configuration ID with the Import Name.
fields.summary: Insight Process Results Details to show the Import Configuration Name

fields.description:
We need to have a flexibility for configuring 'Reply-to' for Jira Service Desk notifications.

*How it works now:*

JSD sets "Reply-to" as per configuration in "Email requests' of JSD project.
 JSD sets "From" as per configuration of Notification scheme email.

There could be situations where customer doesn't want to configure custom email for 'Email requests' (for example, security concern), however would still like to change "Reply-to" email for the project's notifications.

*Suggestion:*

Have option to change "Reply-to" email to match Notification scheme email ("From" email). In this case we make sure that we use _verified domain_ of the instance.

Feedback from customer:
{quote}

I do think it should be more restrictive - I was literally talking about radio-buttons with either 1 option (when there is no inbound channel, matching the From address) or 2 options (when there is an inbound channel AND From address).

I guess to be backward compatible in the 2 option case the default value is to take the inbound channel address.

I was also implying NOT storing the actual email address value, but rather storing the strategy to be used to get the value at the time of sending. In this case the fact that domain is verified - is already taken care of (by the logic that allows or disallows you to set the custom From address)
{quote}
fields.summary: Have option to change "Reply-to" email to another verified domain

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When importing Insight objects using AWS, if the user is syncing with too many accounts and combine with many regions, the test configuration will show as spinning forever on UI which prevents from going to the next step. This is due to the backend API is timing out due to testing too many AWS connections at the same time.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an Insight Object Schema. Go to Object Schema Configuration.
 # Go to Import Tab, Create new Import, select  AWS Import.
 # Enter an import name and click next steps.
 # Fill in AWS Access Key and AWS Access Token.
 # In regions, select about 4 regions such as Sydney, Singapore, US, EU
 # In Roles ARN, enter at least 10 roles from 10 different accounts
 # In Account List, enter about 10 different accounts of the above roles
 # Open Developer Inspection tool, go to the Network tab.
 # Click Test Configuration, you will see that the API requests to `insight-aws-import` will take more than 1 minute to run and then timeout.
 # The UI will keep showing the loading spinning icon forever even that the request is already timeout.

h3. Expected Results
 * It should not timeout and when the testing API is finished, it should proceed to the next step.
 * If it's actually timeout for some reason, the UI should show an error, hide the loading spinning icon and let the user try again.

h3. Actual Results
 * The UI will keep showing the loading spinning icon forever even that the request is already timeout.

h3. Workaround
 * Rather than selecting multiple AWS regions in one big import with many accounts, try to choose only 1 Region at a time, this will make the test API run faster without timing out and the user can still proceed to the next step. Then repeat the step to create a new import for each was region.
fields.summary: Creating AWS Import in Insight Object Schema shows spinning icon forever when selecting too many AWS roles, accounts, and regions

fields.description:
The Insight Azure integration allows the configuration of multiple subscriptions over the same object schema.

However when configuring multiple subscriptions and targeting the same object types in all subscriptions some data inconsistencies can manifest.

Example:

# Configure multiple subscriptions over the same object schema and targeting the same object schema.
# The default configuration for some object types (ex. Virtual Machines) in the import is set such as any previously object (Virtual Machines) not found on the subscription has the attribute status set to not found:
 !Screenshot 2021-08-31 at 09.08.03.png|thumbnail! 
# Now when manually or automatically launching the sync on all those subscriptions, it will happen that as every subscriptions has its own virtual machines, the next scan for another subscription will not find those objects and therefore will mark them as attribute status not found.

At the moment the only way to overcome this is to create multiple object types manually in the schema under an abstract structure such as:

* abstract parent object type > Virtual Machines
* child object types under the parent Virtual Machines:
** Virtual Machines subscription 1
** Virtual Machines subscription 2
* then map each import configuration manually to the child object type. This way the parent one still will show all the child objects virtual machines.

Please improve this behaviour by providing a way to distinguish the objects related to each subscriptions during the import.


attribute to edit when missing objects
fields.summary: improve import configuration options when the Azure integration is used with multiple subscriptions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

[Insight REST API|https://insight-javadoc.riada.io/insight-javadoc-8.6/insight-rest/#iql_objects_get] does not fetch Inbound references. Only Outbound references are retrievable.

REST API mentions referenced object in the Response section, but only works for Outbound references.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create 3 object Types, for example:
 ** Servers
 ** Application
 ** Location
 * In Server object type, create an outbound reference to Location object Type
 * In Application object Type, create an attribute 'Server', Type Object pointing to Servers object type
 * Create some dummy objects

!image-2021-08-26-16-36-20-719.png|thumbnail!

 

!image-2021-08-26-16-37-23-338.png|thumbnail!
 * Use either of the following REST API

{code:java}
/rest/insight/1.0/iql/objects?objectSchemaId={id}&iql=objectType=Servers

/rest/insight/1.0/iql/objects?objectSchemaId={id}&includeAttributesDeep=2&iql=objectType=Servers
{code}
h3. Expected Results

Inbound and outbound reference should be fetched.
h3. Actual Results

Only outbound reference are fetched.

!image-2021-08-26-16-42-36-687.png|thumbnail!

*Nothing* about Inbound references.
h3. Workaround

1) Use an IQL to find all inbound referenced Objects. 
However, if there are many Server objects, it will be required to call REST API as many times as objects are which could be an issue

The IQL would look like the following:
{code:java}
{{host}}:{{port}}/rest/insight/1.0/iql/objects?objectSchemaId={id}&iql=object HAVING outR(Key = {ServerKey})
{code}

2) Server object Type could have an outbound reference to Application object type, but we are storing the same data in multiple objects which is not very efficient.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we move an issue from one Issuetype to another, the below error is thrown if the Request participant field is filled in. If there is no Request participants fields, the move is successful.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a service management project
 # Create an issue and add Request participant
# Try to move the issue to another issuetype

h3. Expected Results
* Issue is moved successfully

h3. Actual Results
* The below error is thrown >


The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2021-08-25 14:30:19,483+0530 http-nio-41310-exec-11 ERROR      [o.a.c.c.C.[.[localhost].[/j81310].[action]] Servlet.service() for servlet [action] in context with path [/j81310] threw exception [java.lang.NullPointerException] with root cause
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.customfields.participants.ParticipantsCFType.getProject(ParticipantsCFType.java:328)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.customfields.participants.ParticipantsCFType.validateFromParams(ParticipantsCFType.java:290)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField.needsMove(ImmutableCustomField.java:1103)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.MoveIssueUpdateFields.doDefault(MoveIssueUpdateFields.java:73)
	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:566)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:70)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:56)
	... 2 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:63)
	... 7 filtered

{noformat}

h3. Workaround
The only workaround is to remove the Participants, move the issue and re-add the participants. 

A simple option to perform this is to configure an automation rule to remove request participants on issue creation and add a comment with the names of participants which can then be added back after moving the issue.
fields.summary: Moving an issue from one issue type to another throws NullpointerException if the Request participants field is filled in

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The current path with [Zero Downtime Upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/upgrading-jira-data-center-with-zero-downtime-938846953.html] (ZDU) when both Jira Software and Jira Service Management (JSM) are installed on the same instance is to manually copy files from the JSM {{.obr}} to the proper location of the {{shared-home}}.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Manual operations on the file system can be error prone, which could impact the upgrade flow.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have a way to rely on all ZDU features without being required to manually copying files from the {{.obr}}.

For example, we could rely on upgrading JSM through the _versions and licenses_ page by clicking on the _update_ button.
That would make the necessary files available, without removing the old {{.jar}} files before the administrator triggers the upgrade tasks.

The below steps are a suggestion and not an actual upgrade path, since following it currently will delete old JSM {{.jar}} files, making the ZDU rollback unfeasible for JSM.
# Put Jira on upgrade mode.
# Upgrade all nodes to the target version.
# Upgrade JSM to the target version by clicking on the _upgrade_ button on the _versions and licenses_ page.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Finalize the ZDU upgrade.
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator I would like to upgrade Jira Service Management with the push of a button when relying on ZDU with Jira Software installed

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Customers are unable to download the OBR from S3 or Marketplace on the older AWS Quickstart templates due to a change in the naming of the AllowedValues on the JiraProduct from Jira Service Desk to Jira Service Management:
{code:none}
  JiraProduct:
    Default: Software
    Description: The Jira product to install. If "All" is selected, Jira Software and Jira Service Management will be installed. A Jira Service Management license is required in "Applications" admin menu after configuring Jira Software.
    Type: String
    ConstraintDescription: 'Must be "Core", "Software", "ServiceManagement", or "All".'
    AllowedValues:
      - Core
      - Software
      - ServiceManagement
      - All 
{code}
h3. Environment

2nd revision of AWS Quickstart template 
 Jira 8.15.0 and 8.17.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Upgrade Jira version
 Try to upgrade the Service Management over UPM
h3. Expected Results

Jira successfully retrieve Jira Service Management JARs the files from S3 or Marketplace
h3. Actual Results

Jira fails to get the JARs and OBR from S3 and Marketplace with the following error:
{code:none}
2021-07-24 04:04:09 Updated server.xml for host name change to $jira-base-url, secure=true, scheme=https, proxyPort=443
2021-07-24 04:04:09 Tomcat connector configuration complete
2021-07-24 04:04:09 Configuring /var/atlassian/application-data/jira
2021-07-24 04:04:09 Setting ownership of /var/atlassian/application-data/jira to 'jira' user
2021-07-24 04:04:09 Done configuring /var/atlassian/application-data/jira
2021-07-24 04:04:09 Fetching and Installing JSD OBR for Jira 8.17.1
2021-07-24 04:04:15 OBR doesnt exist on EFS, trying to fetch it first from marketplace
{code}
h3. Workaround
 - Stop Jira services
 - Copy the following JAR's to the {{JIRA_HOME}}/installed_plugins
 ** jira-servicedesk-application-4.17.1.jar
 ** dependencies/*.jar (Copy all jar's from dependencies folder into {{JIRA_HOME}}/installed_plugins )
 - Restart Jira services

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Changes on AWS Quickstart template are causing failures to upgrade Jira Service Management

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

Currently, there is no possibility to completely and consistently back up and restore Insight data specifically from Jira UI.
 In an event of data disaster, possibilities to restore the data are to use Jira XML backup / restore and to use full native database backup / restore. However, this will also require downtime and will affect Jira's data as well.
h3. Suggested Resolution

Introduce a dedicated Insight backup / restore utility, completely independent of Jira, that would enable users to create and restore Insight dataset while leaving Jira's data untouched.
 The backup procedure would preserve consistency on the database level (unique IDs), similarly like Jira XML backup procedure does.
fields.summary: Introduce dedicated backup / restore functionality for Insight

It does not makes sense to have KB configured in Confluence Cloud and have only first 3 displayed as a result whatever page you navigate to while browsing the entire result.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Insight versions *8.6.13 +*,  users with the *Jira Administrator* permissions are able to access all the Insight Object Schemas even without permission. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using a *System Administrator* account, create a *user A* and add only the *jira-administrators* group for the user.
 # Configure the role *Insight Administrator* to the *System Administrator* group (Insight > Configure > Roles)
 !image-2021-08-18-12-46-21-965.png|width=399,height=90!
 # Create a *test* Insight Object Schema
 # Open the *test* Insight Object Schema and configure the roles only for the *System Administrator* group. 
 !image-2021-08-18-12-49-26-377.png|width=489,height=114!
 # Login with the *user A* account and go to the *Insight Object Schemas* page (Insight > Insight Object Schemas)

h3. Expected Results

The *user A* will not be able to see the test object schema, since the user doesn't have permission.
h3. Actual Results

The *user A* is able to see the test object schema even without permissions.

!image-2021-08-18-12-56-04-531.png|width=847,height=178!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users with Jira Administrator permissions are able to access all the Insight Object Schemas even without permission.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight CSV import ignore text surrounded by <> characters when target attribute is of type TextArea

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a CSV import in an Insight schema.
 # In one attribute value in the source csv insert some text surrounded by <> characters. Ex. this is <a test> for attribute text area.
 # In the object type mapping of the CSV import map the above attribute to a TextArea attribute.
# Launch the sync and observe that the text inside <> has not been imported:
 !Screenshot 2021-08-18 at 13.25.23.png|thumbnail! 

*Please note that this only happen in the 0$ version of Insight (previous and latest 8.7.12).*

In the Insight bundled version with JSM (ex. latest 9.0.12) the text is successfully imported:
 !Screenshot 2021-08-18 at 13.38.15.png|thumbnail! 

This happen with both , and ; delimiters.

h3. Expected Results
text within <> should be imported together with <>.

h3. Actual Results
text surrounded by <> is just ignored (and <> chars too).

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior apart from purging the source file from <> characters.
fields.summary: Insight CSV import ignore text surrounded by <> characters when target attribute is of type TextArea

 # Login JSM portal
 # Open a request from my request
 # Usually, share button is in the right side of the page. Click "share" button, and a popup will show up in the right side as well.
 # Shrink width of browser window.
 # To adapt the size change, "Share" button will go to bottom of the page automatically.

h3. Expected Results
The popup adapt the size change as well. For example showing in the bottom of the page.

h3. Actual Results
 * Popup does not adapt the size change well. It is left in the right side(original place). Even, it may be invisible for user if size changed too much.
 See attached file below.

* Another issue is reported by customer, but not reproduced all the time. Sometimes, when input a word in popup, the suggested user list are not show. The user list has been confirmed in har file, but not showing in the page(maybe not in the right place). It seems an issue related to above issue .

h3. Workaround
 * Do not change browser size.
 * If it is reproduced, try to make the width of browser window bigger.
* If user list is not shown in share request popup, try to change the browser size to it original size(make it bigger), and search it again.
fields.summary: Share request popup in portal does not adapt browser size change

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a customer, I would like to suggest an enhancement to JSM Data Center.

Could you please create a "Resolution Details" or "Resolution Notes" multi-line text field?

I know we already have a "Resolution" field, which contains a closing code, and a "Resolved" field, which contains a date.

However, those are simply not enough.

There is a definite need to have a "Resolution details" multi-line text field added to the top section of an issue, where the final resolution is to be explained in detail.

ITSM systems that compete with Jira typically have that feature, and it just makes sense.

When a very long incident is closed, for example, it is very annoying to have to go through potentially hundreds of comments in order to find what was done to resolve it, especially if the ticket allows adding comments after it has been closed and people still do so for weeks or months.

This is where a "Resolution Details" multi-line text field comes in handy.

Basically, when closing an incident, an agent would add, in that field, what was done to resolve the issue for others to quickly see when referring to this ticket in the future, without having to go through potentially hundreds of comments.

The "Resolution" and "Resolved" fields still have a need, for reporting purposes, but the "Resolution details" multi-line text field is to help out people that will be viewing or referencing this ticket in the future.

I recognize that a custom field could be added to screens in projects in order to allow agents to enter several lines of text.

However, the reason I submitted this request is that option is simply not good enough.

It would make a lot more sense to have a Jira system field for this, which is always present, and always located on the same area in screens, right below the "Description" field.
fields.summary: Add a "Resolutions details" multi-line text field as a system default field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a project created with a service template, when you update a translation of a supported language, you became unable to change the default language.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with a service template(Basic, ITSM,...)
 # Add a new supported language(e.g. Deutsch).
 # Add the custom translations to make the language *up to date.*
 # Change the default language (English (United States) -> Deutsch (Deutschland))
 # Click to edit the 'old' language (English (United States) in this case) and update some fields.
 # Save, go back to the Language support page, and refresh the page.

h3. Expected Results

If your languages are in +up to date+ status and +Available to customers+, you should be able to change the default language through the button *Change default language.*
h3. Actual Results

The button *Change default* language becomes disabled and you're unable to change the default language.

The attached screencast should help to demonstrate:[^actual results 2021-08-16 at 10.48.26.mov]

 
h3. Workaround

Adding another language and filing their translations make the *Change default language* button enabled, although when you change the default language, the translations of the 'old' language will be lost. Attached screencast for reference: [^workaround 2021-08-16 at 11.00.39.mov]
fields.summary: Unable to change project default language for service project.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Customer Portal, Insight Custom Field will display values that belong to the latest Preset value set, even though the field is removed from the "Hidden fields with preset values" section.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create 2 object Types, for example:
 ** Customer
 ** Application
 *** It is displayed on Customer Portal and it filters Applications related to the customer.
 * Create some dummy objects
 * Create 2 Insight custom fields (Insight Object/s). For example:
 ** Customer CF
 *** Filter Scope (IQL): objectType=Customer
 ** Application CF
 *** Filter Scope (IQL): objectType=Application
 *** Filter Issue Scope (IQL): object HAVING outR(Key=${Customer CF})

 * Add "Application CF" to visible fields
 * Add "Customer CF" field to Hidden fields with preset values
 * Set a "Preset value"
 * Remove the "Customer CF" field.

h3. Expected Results

If a user logs on Customer Portal, they should not be able to see any Applications that belong to the Customer we set within preset values as the field was removed.
h3. Actual Results

User sees the applications for the latest customer we set within preset values
h3. Workaround
 * Add back "Customer CF" to the "Hidden fields with preset values" section
 * Edit the Present Value ('Customer CF' field should be empty) and click SET without selecting any Preset Value
 * Remove the "Customer CF" field

If you are not aware of Project and Request Type where Customer_field was removed from, a workaround would be to find out which projects and Request Type where CF was removed from with a hidden value on it.

* "propertyvalue" column show the custom field hidden value. Please replace 'customfield_11111' for your custom field.
{code:sql}
select reverse(split_part(reverse(p.property_key), '_', 1)) as "FormID" from public.propertyentry p 
left join public.propertystring s on p.id = s.id
where p.property_key like '%customfield_11111%' 
{code}

* Find Project Name and Request type taking the FormID
{code:sql}
select vp."KEY"  as "Project", vpf."CALL_TO_ACTION" as "request Type Name",* from public."AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM" vpf
left join public."AO_54307E_VIEWPORT" vp on vp."ID" = vpf."VIEWPORT_ID" 
where vpf."ID" = {Use_Here_FormID_Identified_Previous_Query}
{code}

* From the above output, Project ID and Request Type name will be displayed. 
* Access to each of them and carry out the first 3 steps of the workaround mentioned here.
fields.summary: Insight Custom field on Customer Portal retains the value previously preset in "Hidden fields with preset values" section

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With off-threading enabled, {{AO_319474_MESSAGE}} database table is growing and most *SdSerialisedOffThreadProcessor* threads are stuck waiting for cluster lock.

Checking the {{clusterlockstatus}} database table, the cluster locks held by the Jira node are associated to issues with substantial amount of comments (~5000 comments) and the MESSAGE_COUNT for those issues are high.

This can happen when SLA events are being processed off thread with database backed events.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Update issue comment that trigger SLA update whilst issues are being created by multiple concurrent users.
h3. Expected Results

Relevant SLA and automation are updated.
h3. Actual Results

SLA and automation are not updated.

Most *SdSerialisedOffThreadProcessor* threads are in cluster lock wait, e.g:
{code:java}
"SdSerialisedOffThreadProcessor:thread-1" #1484 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007efa7359f000 nid=0x3afde waiting on condition [0x00007ef809f8f000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (sleeping)
	at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Native Method)
	at com.atlassian.beehive.db.DatabaseClusterLock.sleep(DatabaseClusterLock.java:621)
	at com.atlassian.beehive.db.DatabaseClusterLock.uninterruptibleWait(DatabaseClusterLock.java:127)
	at com.atlassian.beehive.db.DatabaseClusterLock.lock(DatabaseClusterLock.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.customfield.SlaFieldUpdateLockManagerImpl.lockSlaUpdate(SlaFieldUpdateLockManagerImpl.java:24){code}
h3. Workaround

One option is to disable off thread processing for SLA events. This is not always recommended, as it will result in SLAs being calculated on the HTTP threads so users may notice slower response times on the UI. 
 # Go to the dark feature settings page ({{{}<baseURL>/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa{}}})
 # Remove the feature flag {{{}sd.internal.base.off.thread.on.completion.events.enabled{}}}, if it exists
 # Add the following feature flag: {{sd.internal.base.off.thread.on.completion.events.disabled}}
 # Restart JIRA

h3. Additional fixVersion

A more complete fix, which improves the way that cluster locks are handled with off-threading enabled is available in 4.21.0, enabled by default, and also in Jira 4.13.15+, and 4.20.3+, enabled by setting dark features (ensuring any dark features ending with *on.completion.events.disabled*  are removed):
{code:java}
sd.internal.bounded.off.thread.on.completion.events.enabled
sd.internal.base.db.backed.completion.events.enabled
sd.internal.base.heartbeat.automatic.renewal.events.enabled{code}
fields.summary: Off-threading caused most threads to enter cluster lock wait
